titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flora Moon Papers
titlestmt.author: Emily Brooks

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Flora Moon Papers 1976/2012

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The majority of this collection contains documentation and notes pertaining to the creation of the short documentary film The Living Tree. Other items include film scripts, periodicals and ephemera from her film career.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: Flora Moon is a film maker based in Los Angeles, Houston and Boston. Born in Indiana to Chinese immigrants Wei Ning and Tack-Shing Li, Flora knew very little about her Chinese roots growing up until her aunt De Ping moved to the United States in the 1980’s. She learned about her family’s recent history and how they were targeted during the Communist Revolution, as well as their ties to the Tang Dynasty. After visiting the People’s Republic of China and meeting her extended family, Flora created a short documentary film, The Living Tree about her journey discovering her Chinese roots. The majority of this collection contains correspondence, financial information, grant applications and proposals, historical and family research, production notes, audio-visual materials and books pertaining to the research and production of this documentary. Other items include film scripts, periodicals and ephemera from Flora Moon’s film career.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Flora Moon Papers. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of this collection contains documentation and notes pertaining to the creation of the short documentary film The Living Tree. Other items include film scripts, periodicals and ephemera from her film career.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contact Lists and correspondence with Living Tree consultants, family in China and the United States, and correspondence with museums and archives regarding image rights for The Living Tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Budgets, financing notes, receipts and other financial records related to the production of The Living Tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant applications and responses, organized by funding organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Research notes, images and materials related to the research and production of The Living Tree, including personal photos.

The Cold War Era in the U.S Part 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Production notes, rough cuts, script drafts, outlines and thumbnails for the production of the film The Living Tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issues of periodicals edited by or contributed to by Flora Moon, speeches, materials from the Where is Home? Conference, brochures and four scripts.

scopecontent.p: Tapes, discs and cassettes, mostly to do with the Living Tree.
